intro: Tragacantha keyserlingii, commonly known as the keyserling's tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant produces a gum resin, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Tragacantha keyserlingii thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its ecological role includes supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
